Articles.Content:
I was just wondering?

P.S. Don't forget to use the poll!
Playing on 13", i guess most people have bigger windows than my "fullscreen"...
Windowed mode, as it lets me access other programs like Firefox more easily, alt+tab can cause issues with KSP

I play in full screen (as I just voted). I don't know if playing in windowed mode would help my lag much, though I'm playing on a laptop thats around 2-3 years old. Most of the time I have the graphics set as low as possible but on occasion I set textures and "anti jaggies" as high as they can go.
Windowed, full-screen max res tends to melt my PC.
Window, so that I can switch between it, the forum, the wiki, and Music Player with just a click.
Fullscreen because MY SCREEN CAN'T FIT THE LOWEST SETTING BECAUSE OF THE BAR ON THE BOTTOM OF THE SCREEN (I use Windows 7) So I want 800x600 back.
Fullscreen, I have 17" and 1280x1024-it's an old monitor

Windowed Mode, but using the -popupwindow command line switch - so I can fill my primary monitor (effectively fullscreen), but still use other apps on my second - like searching the forum for how to do something

PS. If you have two screens try -popupwindow , it will change your experience
Goin' all the way, baby! Full screen it!
Full screen, because I have a tablet with a stand for my interweb browsing

Borderless, because KSP actually supports that. And my screen is small, so I like being able to use as much of it as possible without getting annoying memory problems. It also means alt-tabbing isn't a problem.
Window because I like to do things on my second monitor when playing
Fake fulll screen mode. So i can browse forum and stuff on the 2nd screen.

Windowed Mode, but using the -popupwindow command line switch - so I can fill my primary monitor (effectively fullscreen), but still use other apps on my second - like searching the forum for how to do something

PS. If you have two screens try -popupwindow , it will change your experience

I am in love with you now. Thank you very much!
I normally use fullscreen, but if I need to do other things while playing, I just temporarily switch to windowed.
